titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the James Joseph Daly Papers
titlestmt.author: by Beinecke staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday April 23, 2019 at 04:13

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: Collection contains correspondence, writings, and personal papers documenting the life and professional activity of poet and playwright James Joseph Daly. Correspondence in the collection consists chiefly of incoming correspondence from writers, journal editors, publishers, and others, but also includes drafts and carbons of outgoing letters and writings and enclosures. Correspondents include Elizabeth Ames at Yaddo, Kenneth Burke, John Cheever, Padraic Colum, Malcolm Cowley at The New Republic, James T. Farrell, Robinson Jeffers, Alfred Kreymborg, Haniel Long, Archibald MacLeish, Henry Miller, Kenneth Rexroth, Lennox Robinson, and Thornton Wilder. Writings in the collection include drafts of plays, poems, and other writings, such as short essays, sketches, scenes of plays, reviews, notes, and school papers. Personal papers feature notebooks and material relating to the theater, including manuscript material, correspondence, and printed materials, such as playbills and clippings.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Purchased from Margo Perkins on the Eugene G. O'Neill Memorial Fund, 2001.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The James Joseph Daly Papers is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: James Joseph Daly Papers. Yale Collection of American Literature, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection received a basic level of processing, including rehousing and in some instances minimal organization.

The finding aid for this collection is compiled from a preliminary list created at or around the time of receipt by the library. The preliminary list was migrated to comply with current archival descriptive standards in 2007-2008. As part of the migration, modifications were made to the formatting of the list; however, the content of the list was neither modified nor verified.

As a rule, descriptive information found in the Collection Contents section is drawn in large part from information supplied with the collection and from an initial survey of the contents. Folder titles appearing in the contents list below are often based on those provided by the creator or previous custodian. Titles have not been verified against the contents of the folders in all cases. Otherwise, folder titles are supplied by staff during initial processing.
This finding aid may be updated to account for new acquisitions to the collection and/or revisions in arrangement and description.

bioghist.head: James Joseph Daly (1901-)
bioghist.p: The poet and playwright James Joseph Daly was born in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania and educated at the Carnegie Institute of Technology and at Harvard University, where he studied drama with George Pierce Baker and was a student in Baker's famous "47 Workshop" course. A member of the American Theater Laboratory, Daly occassionally acted in professional theaters and served as director of theaters in various parts of the country. Daly also worked as a copy-writer and editor for N. W. Ayer, Standard Oil Company of Ohio, and the WPA California. Works by Daly include The Guilty Sun (1926), One Season Shattered (1936), and Poems: 1923-1943 (1943).
Biographical information taken from The Dryden Press publicity for Poems: 1923-1943 (1943).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The James Joseph Daly papers contain correspondence, writings, and personal papers documenting the life and professional activity of poet and playwright James Joseph Daly. Correspondence in the collection consists chiefly of incoming correspondence from writers, journal editors, publishers, and others, but also includes drafts and carbons of outgoing letters and writings and enclosures. Correspondents include Elizabeth Ames at Yaddo, Kenneth Burke, John Cheever, Padraic Colum, Malcolm Cowley at The New Republic , James T. Farrell, Robinson Jeffers, Alfred Kreymborg, Haniel Long, Archibald MacLeish, Henry Miller, Kenneth Rexroth, Lennox Robinson, and Thornton Wilder. Writings in the collection include drafts of plays, poems, and other writings, such as short essays, sketches, scenes of plays, reviews, notes, and school papers. Personal papers feature notebooks and material relating to the theater, including manuscript material, correspondence, and printed material, such as playbills and clippings.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into three series: I. Correspondence, 1919-1949. II. Writings, 1921-1943. III. Personal Papers, 1916-1945.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series I. Correspondence consists chiefly of incoming correspondence from writers, journal editors, publishers, and others, but also includes drafts and carbons of outgoing letters and writings and enclosures.

Correspondents include Elizabeth Ames at Yaddo, Kenneth Burke, John Cheever, Padraic Colum, Malcolm Cowley at The New Republic , James T. Farrell, Robinson Jeffers, Alfred Kreymborg, Haniel Long, Archibald MacLeish, Henry Miller, Kenneth Rexroth, Lennox Robinson, and Thornton Wilder.

did.unittitle: Letters re. James Daly's poetry; copyrights
Letters and Clippings re. James Daly and his work

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into three subseries: Plays, Poetry and Other Writings, and Writings by Others.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series II. contains writings by Daly and others. The Plays subseries consists chiefly of theatrical scripts and work by Daly. Poems and Other Writings are essentially unsorted writings, with a mix of drafts of poems and other writings, including short essays, sketches, scenes of plays, reviews, notes, and school papers, as well as some correspondence and other material, such as printed ephemera and clippings.

did.unittitle: Poems with comments by Charles Harris
Fletcher, James Gould: "Can Communism be Colonial?"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series III. Personal Papers contain notebooks, material relating to the theater, and a small amount of other material. Theater materials include printed ephemera, such as playbills and clippings containing reviews of plays, manuscript material, and correspondence.
